metadata.Title: CVE-2017-18926 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
raptor_xml_writer_start_element_common in raptor_xml_writer.c in Raptor RDFSyntax Library 2.0.15 miscalculates the maximum nspace declarations for theXML writer, leading to heap-based buffer overflows (sometimes seen inraptor_qname_format_as_xml).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-18926` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraptor2-0 - 2.0.14-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
raptor2-utils - 2.0.14-1ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: raptor package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
raptor2 package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.14-1ubuntu0.16.04.1').
